answerText: superfluidity [or word forms][10] This Soviet physicist won a Nobel for developing a theory that explained the superfluidity of helium II below the lambda point. He also names a phenomenological model of superconductivity with Vitaly Ginzburg.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 3 | 2 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This property occurs in helium II cooled to less than approximately 2.17 Kelvins, which is the lambda point. For 10 points each [10] Name this property of certain materials that have zero viscosity.
